dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model
Class Ref

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Any
      dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Ref

public class Ref
extends Any

Handles reference specific features of a Ctxt object.

Reading referenced

References store the path to an other node as their value. This other node may exist or not. The path can be in any valid path format.

To query if a node is a reference the method isRef() can be used: 

 ctxt.ref.isRef( "Suspected/Ref" );
To inspect a reference the following methods can be used:
  • To query the value of references (getValue...)
  • Navigate to the referenced node (toRef...)
  • Get a context object of the referenced node (getRef...)
  • To query if the reference is valid (isValidRef...)
  • To query all referenceable nodes (getValidRefs...)
E.g.: 

 ctxt.ref.getValue(); // my return for example: ASPath:/MyPkg/MyModule/General
returns the literal path that is stored in the context reference as a String. 
 boolean sucess = ctxt.ref.toRef();
Navigates the context to the node referenced by the context node. 
 DCtxt referenceNode = ctxt.ref.getRef();
Returns the context of the referenced node. 
 boolean valid = ctxt.ref.isValidRef();
Returns true if the referenced node exists is valid (which means that ctxt.ref.getRef() would return a context. 
 List<DCtxt> validRefs = ctxt.ref.getValidRefs();
returns context for all referenceable nodes.

Writing references

References can be edited with either:
  • setValue(java.lang.String)
  • setValues(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, java.lang.String[])
  • addValue(java.lang.String)
  • insertValue(int, java.lang.String)
or with:
  • setRef(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt)
  • addRefs(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt[])
  • addRef(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt)
  • insertRef(int, dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt)
The setValue(s) methods take a string as input which must be a path: 
 ctxt.ref.setValue( "ASPath:/MyPkg/MyModule/General" );
The setRef(s) methods allow to reference to an existing other node by handing in a DCtxt: 
 DCtxt referenceCtxt = ctxt.get( "ASPath:/MyPkg/MyModule/General" );
 ctxt.ref.setRef( referenceCtxt );

Converting references

This class provides a method convertRefs(dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr.IMExpr, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) that allows to bulk change a list of references. The method uses the AbstractPathTransformer API to change the referenced nodes of the found references. 
 ctxt.ref.changeRefs( new MXPath( "CanIf/CanIfControllerConfig/*" +
                                  "/CanIfDriverNameRef" ),
                                  "ASPath" ),
                                  "/?/?/TestDriver",
                                  "/$0/$1/RealDriver" );
The example can be called to update all "CanIfDriverNameRef" that previously pointed to a "TestDriver" to now point to a "RealDriver".

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.a

setValues

public boolean setValues(IMExpr expr,
                         java.lang.String[] values)
                  throws CtxtException
Changes the values of a list of references calculated via an IMExpr. If the nodes exceed the number of values the last value is used for all exceeding nodes. Non reference nodes are ignored.

Parameters:
expr - The expression to evaluate
values - The values to set (null values mean default value)
Throws:
CtxtException

toRef

public DCtxt toRef(java.lang.String path,
                   int idx)
            throws CtxtException
Navigate the context to the referenced node. The method navigates to the value of the referenced node if the referenced node is a ReferenceDataNode or the value of the first ReferenceDataNode in a list of ReferenceDataNodes.

Parameters:
idx - The list index conted from 1
Returns:
the current context or null
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
2008.a

             throws CtxtException

Returns:
false on error
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error

setRef

public boolean setRef(DCtxt ctxt)
               throws CtxtException
Sets the reference to point to the given context. If the node is a list and the first item in the list is a reference this reference is changed. Reference type is dertermined via the REF-TYPE attribute of the bound schema node.

Parameters:
ctxt - The node to reference to
Returns:
false on error
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
2008.a

convertRefs

public boolean convertRefs(IMExpr expr,
                           java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String match,
                           java.lang.String replacement)
                    throws CtxtException
This method converts references. The method searches for a list of nodes via an IMExpr. For all found nodes that are references their values are transformed via a path transformer (AbstractPathTransformer.

Parameters:
expr - The expression via which to search for nodes
type - The type of the path transformer (ASPath, XPath, REPath)
match - The match expression
replacement - The replacement expression
Returns:
false on error
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
2008.a

isValidRef

public boolean isValidRef()
                   throws CtxtException
Checks if the reference references a valid node.

Returns:
true if the context node references a valid node. false if not or context is no valid reference
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error

getRefs

public java.util.List<DCtxt> getRefs()
                              throws CtxtException
Get the referenced contexts of a list with ReferenceDataNodes. If the context-node points to a ReferenceDataNode and not to a list the value of this node is returned.

Returns:
The referenced contexts of the context node if the context is a list of references. null on error.
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
2008.a

getConfigClass

public java.lang.String getConfigClass()
                                throws CtxtException
Queries the config class of the referenced node.

Possible return values are PublishedInformation, PreCompile, Link and PostBuild.

Returns:
the effective config class of the node or null
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
13.0

getConfigClass

public java.lang.String getConfigClass(java.lang.String path)
                                throws CtxtException
Queries the config class of the referenced node.

Possible return values are PublishedInformation, PreCompile, Link and PostBuild.

Returns:
the effective config class of the node or null
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
13.0

isReadPermitted

public boolean isReadPermitted()
                        throws CtxtException
Checks if the value of the referenced node may be read from this context.

Reading the value of a node can be prohibited due to the config class of the context. E.g. a code generator that is registered for config class PreCompile must not read any variables with later config classes (i.e. Link or PostBuild).

Returns:
true, if the node may be read from this context, false otherwise
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
13.0

isReadPermitted

public boolean isReadPermitted(java.lang.String path)
                        throws CtxtException
Checks if the value of the referenced node may be read from this context.

Reading the value of a node can be prohibited due to the config class of the context. E.g. a code generator that is registered for config class PreCompile must not read any variables with later config classes (i.e. Link or PostBuild).

Returns:
true, if the node may be read from this context, false otherwise
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
13.0
